Before You Begin

Introduction

Before you begin contributing to DLF MAWG’s sites, we recommend becoming familiar with command line interfaces, Git, GitHub, Github Pages, and Jekyll.

Understanding the GitHub flow, which this workflow largley uses, will go a long way to ensuring that your experience with this group is a pleasant one!

To facilitate this learning, the DLF MAWG maintains a skill-building resource that can be found on the DLF MAWG website’s Skillbuilding page. Topics addressed in this resource include:

  • The command line.

  • Git.

  • GitHub.

  • And more!

In addition to these resources, you may also find the following resources useful:

  • Github’s Learning Lab: This resource provides interactive tutorials on numerous topics.

  • Learning GitHub: This LinkedIn Learning course provides a broad overview of GitHub and Git.

  • GitHub Documentation: GitHub’s official documentation, which was used to create this website.

As you begin to experiment with Git, GitHub, and Jekyll, just remember that:

  • Mistakes are very easily reversed - so please feel free to experiment!

  • If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please reach out the DLF MAWG group members listed in the Maintenance page. They will be happy to help you out!

Next Steps

Once you are more familiar these topics, or if you are a GitHub veteran, please navigate to the Installation page to begin installing necessary software and setting up your GitHub environments.
